definition: (of competition or fighting) intense/fierce/(of pain) acute/(of an expression of opinion) impassioned/vehement/(of a course of action) drastic/extreme
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: It is an inevitable choice to develop the strategy of famous brand for an enterprise in the keen market competitions.
sentences.chinese: 实施名牌战略是企业在激烈的市场竞争中的必然选择。

sentences.english: His heart is beating violently in her breast.
sentences.chinese: 他的心在胸膛里激烈地跳动。

sentences.english: But the consensus around the Gulf Coast is turning more apoplectic and apocalyptic.
sentences.chinese: 但在墨西哥湾海岸的舆论正变得越来越激烈和末世论。

sentences.english: An intense ring of stars forms at the outer edges of the new, combined galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 激烈的环星形式在外层空间边缘，新合并的星系。

sentences.english: The issue of human rights is widely agitated.
sentences.chinese: 人权问题引起广泛而激烈的辩论。

sentences.english: That particular screenshot mentioned shows off a visceral fight between Marauders and Immortals.
sentences.chinese: 这张截屏展示了掠夺者和不朽者的激烈战斗。

sentences.english: Intense, coconut and vanilla, with a hint of sultana, lemon and peat.
sentences.chinese: 激烈，椰子和香草，并暗示苏丹娜，柠檬和泥炭。

sentences.english: As the market environment changing competition in the market is hotting up visibly.
sentences.chinese: 随着市场环境的变化，市场竞争更加激烈。

sentences.english: The story begins in the middle of the fierce fighting of the second world war.
sentences.chinese: 故事开始于二战中期的激烈战斗。

sentences.english: Tense negotiations were under way in the State Department conference room.
sentences.chinese: 在国务院会议厅里，正进行着激烈的协商。

sentences.english: But mating also involves plenty of competition between the sexes.
sentences.chinese: 但交配同时还涉及两性间激烈的竞争。

sentences.english: Academic contends on the founding of Periodical Science is a rather fierce topic in the periodicals-related circle in China.
sentences.chinese: 期刊学是我国期刊界学术争鸣比较激烈的研究领域。

sentences.english: The country was torn apart by fierce intertribal hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 种族间的激烈冲突把这个国家弄得四分五裂。

sentences.english: A moment of low intensity in a televised football game is seen by some as time to change channels.
sentences.chinese: 转播的足球比赛若是稍不激烈，一些人就准备换台。
上海是一个竞争异常激烈的城市。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
